alert.note: Alert for Newberry; Richland; Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 11:13AM EST until January 04 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following areas, Fairfield, Kershaw, Lexington, Newberry, Richland and Saluda. * WHEN...Until 115 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1113 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbia, Lexington, West Columbia, Cayce, Irmo, Forest Acres, Newberry, Springdale, VC Summer Nuclear Station, Highway 6 at Lake Murray Dam, Red Bank, St. Andrews, Oak Grove, Dentsville, Saluda, Pine Ridge, Elgin, Prosperity, Arcadia Lakes and Dreher Island State Park. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 26 between mile markers 65 and 115. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 54 and 91. Interstate 77 between mile markers 0 and 35. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
